verses.kjv: Men, brethren, and fathers, hear ye my defence which I make now unto you.
verses.ct: "Brothers and fathers, listen to the defense I'm about to present to you."

verses.kjv: (And when they heard that he spake in the Hebrew tongue to them, they kept the more silence: and he saith,)
verses.ct: When they realized he was speaking to them in the Hebrew language, they became even quieter. Then he continued,

verses.kjv: I am verily a man which am a Jew, born in Tarsus, a city in Cilicia, yet brought up in this city at the feet of Gamaliel, and taught according to the perfect manner of the law of the fathers, and was zealous toward God, as ye all are this day.
verses.ct: "I am a Jewish man, born in Tarsus, a city in Cilicia, but raised right here in this city. I was trained under Gamaliel in the strictest interpretation of our ancestral law, and I was passionately dedicated to God — just as all of you are today.

verses.kjv: And I persecuted this way unto the death, binding and delivering into prisons both men and women.
verses.ct: I persecuted the followers of this Way to the point of death, arresting both men and women and throwing them into prison.

verses.kjv: As also the high priest doth bear me witness, and all the estate of the elders: from whom also I received letters unto the brethren, and went to Damascus, to bring them which were there bound unto Jerusalem, for to be punished.
verses.ct: The high priest and the entire council of elders can confirm this. I even obtained letters from them addressed to the Jewish community in Damascus, and I traveled there to arrest the believers and bring them back to Jerusalem in chains to be punished.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, as I made my journey, and was come nigh unto Damascus about noon, suddenly there shone from heaven a great light round about me.
verses.ct: As I was on my way and approaching Damascus around noon, suddenly a brilliant light from heaven flashed all around me.

verses.kjv: And I fell unto the ground, and heard a voice saying unto me, Saul, Saul, why persecutest thou me?
verses.ct: I fell to the ground and heard a voice saying to me, 'Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me?'

verses.kjv: And I answered, Who art thou, Lord? And he said unto me, I am Jesus of Nazareth, whom thou persecutest.
verses.ct: I replied, 'Who are you, Lord?' He told me, 'I am Jesus of Nazareth, the one you are persecuting.'

verses.kjv: And they that were with me saw indeed the light, and were afraid; but they heard not the voice of him that spake to me.
verses.ct: The people traveling with me did see the light and were terrified, but they couldn't understand the voice of the one speaking to me.

verses.kjv: And I said, What shall I do, LORD? And the Lord said unto me, Arise, and go into Damascus; and there it shall be told thee of all things which are appointed for thee to do.
verses.ct: I asked, 'What should I do, Lord?' The Lord told me, 'Get up and go into Damascus, and there you will be told everything that has been assigned for you to do.'

verses.kjv: And when I could not see for the glory of that light, being led by the hand of them that were with me, I came into Damascus.
verses.ct: Since I couldn't see because of the intensity of that light, my companions took me by the hand and led me into Damascus.

verses.kjv: And one Ananias, a devout man according to the law, having a good report of all the Jews which dwelt there,
verses.ct: A man named Ananias came to see me. He was a devout man who followed the law and was highly respected by all the Jewish residents there.

verses.kjv: Came unto me, and stood, and said unto me, Brother Saul, receive thy sight. And the same hour I looked up upon him.
verses.ct: He stood beside me and said, 'Brother Saul, receive your sight!' At that very moment, I could see, and I looked up at him.

verses.kjv: And he said, The God of our fathers hath chosen thee, that thou shouldest know his will, and see that Just One, and shouldest hear the voice of his mouth.
verses.ct: Then he said, 'The God of our ancestors has chosen you to understand his will, to see the Righteous One, and to hear words directly from his mouth.

verses.kjv: For thou shalt be his witness unto all men of what thou hast seen and heard.
verses.ct: You will serve as his witness to everyone, telling them about what you have seen and heard.

verses.kjv: And now why tarriest thou? arise, and be baptized, and wash away thy sins, calling on the name of the Lord.
verses.ct: So what are you waiting for? Get up, be baptized, and have your sins washed away by calling on the name of the Lord.'

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, that, when I was come again to Jerusalem, even while I prayed in the temple, I was in a trance;
verses.ct: Later, after I returned to Jerusalem, I was praying in the temple and fell into a trance.

verses.kjv: And saw him saying unto me, Make haste, and get thee quickly out of Jerusalem: for they will not receive thy testimony concerning me.
verses.ct: I saw the Lord, and he told me, 'Hurry! Leave Jerusalem immediately, because the people here will not accept your testimony about me.'

verses.kjv: And I said, Lord, they know that I imprisoned and beat in every synagogue them that believed on thee:
verses.ct: I said, 'Lord, they know very well that I went from synagogue to synagogue imprisoning and beating those who believed in you.

verses.kjv: And when the blood of thy martyr Stephen was shed, I also was standing by, and consenting unto his death, and kept the raiment of them that slew him.
verses.ct: And when the blood of your witness Stephen was being shed, I was standing right there giving my approval of his death and guarding the clothing of those who killed him.'

verses.kjv: And he said unto me, Depart: for I will send thee far hence unto the Gentiles.
verses.ct: But he told me, 'Go, because I am sending you far away to the Gentiles.'"

verses.kjv: And they gave him audience unto this word, and then lifted up their voices, and said, Away with such a fellow from the earth: for it is not fit that he should live.
verses.ct: The crowd listened to Paul up to this point, but then they started shouting, "Get rid of this man! He doesn't deserve to live!"

verses.kjv: And as they cried out, and cast off their clothes, and threw dust into the air,
verses.ct: As they were screaming, ripping off their cloaks, and throwing dust into the air,

verses.kjv: The chief captain commanded him to be brought into the castle, and bade that he should be examined by scourging; that he might know wherefore they cried so against him.
verses.ct: the commanding officer ordered that Paul be taken into the barracks. He directed that Paul be interrogated under flogging so he could find out why the crowd was so furious with him.

verses.kjv: And as they bound him with thongs, Paul said unto the centurion that stood by, Is it lawful for you to scourge a man that is a Roman, and uncondemned?
verses.ct: As they were strapping him down with leather straps, Paul said to the centurion standing nearby, "Is it legal for you to flog a Roman citizen who hasn't even been found guilty of anything?"

verses.kjv: When the centurion heard that, he went and told the chief captain, saying, Take heed what thou doest: for this man is a Roman.
verses.ct: When the centurion heard this, he went to the commanding officer and reported, "Be careful about what you're doing — this man is a Roman citizen."

verses.kjv: Then the chief captain came, and said unto him, Tell me, art thou a Roman? He said, Yea.
verses.ct: The commanding officer went to Paul and asked, "Tell me, are you a Roman citizen?" Paul answered, "Yes, I am."

verses.kjv: And the chief captain answered, With a great sum obtained I this freedom. And Paul said, But I was free born.
verses.ct: The commanding officer said, "I paid a huge amount of money to get my citizenship." Paul replied, "I was born a citizen."

verses.kjv: Then straightway they departed from him which should have examined him: and the chief captain also was afraid, after he knew that he was a Roman, and because he had bound him.
verses.ct: Immediately, the men who were about to interrogate him backed away. The commanding officer himself became alarmed when he realized that he had put a Roman citizen in chains.

verses.kjv: On the morrow, because he would have known the certainty wherefore he was accused of the Jews, he loosed him from his bands, and commanded the chief priests and all their council to appear, and brought Paul down, and set him before them.
verses.ct: The next day, wanting to determine exactly why Paul was being accused by the Jewish leaders, he released him from his restraints and ordered the chief priests and the entire council to assemble. Then he brought Paul down and had him stand before them.
